name: The Waste and Resources Action Programme
goal:
Established as a not-for-profit company in 2000 to deliver a step change increase in the low recycling rates across the UK, WRAP is now a registered charity with a broadened role of waste prevention, resource efficiency and the sustainability of products and materials. Our mission is to accelerate the move to a sustainable resource-efficient economy both in the UK and internationally through:
• re-inventing how we design, produce and sell products,
• re-thinking how we use and consume products, and
• re-defining what is possible through recycling and re-use

We act as a catalyst, accelerating change in the behaviour of consumers and the public and private sectors in the key areas of: food and drink; resource management; and manufactured goods (in particular textiles and electricals).
interests: Climate Action, Consumers, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health
euInitiatives: Member of the EU platform on food waste and food losses.
